ATTUNED.Definition: able to understand or recognise something

BEETROOT.Definition: the small, round, dark red root of a plant, eaten cooked as a vegetable, especially cold in salads

BETTER OFF.Definition: to be in a better situation

BETTING.Definition: to risk a sum of money on the unknown result of an event in the hope of winning more money than you have risked

CARDBOARD.Definition: material like very thick, stiff paper, usually pale brown in colour, used especially for making boxes

CATTLE.Definition: a group of animals that includes cows, buffalo, and bison, that are often kept for their milk or meat

CELLS.Definition: the smallest basic unit of a plant or animal

DITCH.Definition: to get rid of something or someone that is no longer wanted

EFFICIENT.Definition: working or operating quickly and effectively in an organised way

FEW AND FAR BETWEEN.Definition: not happening or existing very often

FIZZLES OUT.Definition: to gradually end, often in a disappointing or weak way

GO THE WAY.Definition: follow the same fate, end up the same as

HURDLES.Definition: a problem that you have to deal with before you can make progress

IN ESSENCE.Definition: the basic or most important idea or quality of something

INTAKE.Definition: the amount of a particular substance that is eaten or drunk

INVESTORS.Definition: a person who puts money into something in order to make a profit or get an advantage

LAMENTING.Definition: expressing sadness and feeling sorry about something

LIVESTOCK.Definition: animals and birds that are kept on a farm, such as cows, sheep, or chickens

LOBBY.Definition: a group of people who try to persuade the government or an official group to do something

LOCK IN.Definition: to get and keep an advantage such as a low price

NICHE.Definition: interesting to, aimed at, or affecting only a small number of people

NUTRIENTS.Definition: any substance that plants or animals need in order to live and grow

NUTRITIONAL.Definition: containing a food substance your body can use

OBSESSED.Definition: unable to stop thinking about something; too interested in or worried about something

OVERCOME.Definition: to defeat or succeed in controlling or dealing with something

PLETHORA.Definition: a very large amount of something, especially a larger amount than you need, want, or can deal with

PROTEIN.Definition: one of the many substances found in food such as meat, cheese, fish, or eggs, that is necessary for the body to grow and be strong

PROTEINS.Definition: one of the many substances found in food such as meat, cheese, fish, or eggs, that is necessary for the body to grow and be strong

RAISE.Definition: to take care of a person, or an animal or plant, until they are completely grown

REGULATION.Definition: an official rule or the act of controlling something

REGULATORY.Definition: of or relating to a person or organisation whose job is to control an activity or process or to the regulations themselves

REPLICATED.Definition: made or done again in exactly the same way

ROSY.Definition: if a situation is described as rosy, it gives hope of success or happiness

SERVING.Definition: an amount of one type of food that is given to one person

SLAUGHTER.Definition: the killing of many people or animals cruelly and unfairly, especially in a war

SMART MONEY.Definition: money that is bet (= risked) or invested (= put into something in order to make a profit) by people who know a lot about a subject

SMOTHERED.Definition: to cover most or all of a surface

SWITCH.Definition: to change suddenly or completely, especially from one thing to another, or to exchange by replacing one person or thing with another

TEXTURE.Definition: the quality of something that can be decided by touch or feeling

VALID.Definition: based on truth or reason ; able to be accepted

VEGAN.Definition: a person who does not eat or use any animal products, such as meat, fish, eggs, cheese, or leather

VEHEMENTLY.Definition: in a strong and emotional way

VIABLE.Definition: able to work as intended or able to succeed
